Job Title: Assistant Media Planner

Location: New York City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Advertising, Marketing

Description:
Job SummaryUSIM is a full-service, integrated, media planning and buying agency. We are media agnostic – aligning the most successful and efficient media strategies with the goals of our clients, regardless of channel. The Assistant Media Planner will assist in the day-to-day management of the media negotiates and purchased for various clients within our media firm. This position also helps with the ancillary needs to develop a media plan/strategy.
RESPONSIBILITIES:Assist in creating producing, and reviewing all aspects of output for clients and the Investment Team, including monthly and quarterly performance reports, annual deep-dive performance reports, benchmark and comparative analysisExperience with Meta, TikTok & Programmatic channels are a plusUtilize internal reporting systems to monitor media partner activity as well as to compile and distribute reportsExperience in DCM is a plusWork collaboratively with teams on campaign management and check in on pacing and reporting regularlyUtilize media research and planning tools and be able to master their use with appropriate training and initiative to learn such as ComScore, Pathmatics, Nielsen, DCMBe proactive in offering thoughts around investment performance & overarching media/campaign strategy; be engaged on new ideas and trends around performance reporting within the industry.Handle variety of ad-hoc data projects, as needed, with high attention to detail.Assist & Eventually own billing and actualization process / present monthly to internal teams & clientsDemonstrate an increased understanding of digital campaign management, including the planning and buying processSupport team in creating client strategies, media plans and flowchartsSupport with buysheets, insertion orders and media authorizations
QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:
Proficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, OutlookProficient in mathAnalytics skills a plusOrganizedExcellent written and oral communication skillsPerform well within a team structureRespect confidentiality both corporately and with client informationEfficient work ethic both in time and resourcesAble to multitask and prioritizePunctual
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree, preferably with a concentration in advertising, marketing, business administration and/or communications 
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.The employee will spend up to 50% of time sitting at desk, typing on keyboard, viewing computer monitor, answering telephone calls.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear.The employee is occasionally required to walk; use hands and fingers, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and reach with hands and arms.The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus. 
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.The noise level in the work environment is usually moderately quiet.  
SELECTION GUIDELINES:
Formal application, rating of education and experience; oral interviews and reference check; job-related tests may be required.
EEO
USIM is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a work environment that is free of discrimination and harassment. It does not discriminate against applicants or employees with respect to any terms or conditions of employment on account of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, physical or mental disability (actual or perceived), medical condition including genetic characteristics, marital status, citizenship status, military service status, gender, gender identity, registered domestic partner status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. USIM also prohibits discrimination based on the perception that anyone has any of those characteristics or is associated with a person who has or is perceived as having any of those characteristics. This commitment applies to all persons involved in the operations of USIM , and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee of USIM, including supervisors and co-workers. All employment decisions shall be consistent with the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
